result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:02 PM Defendant Isaac Allen James Smith not in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Isaac Allen James Smith.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21TR511 21TR509 21CF163 21FO274 21FO320 22CF07 22CF29, cites appearance. Court reviews case history. As to 22CF29 - he does not qualify for a public defender, nor has he completed court appointed attorney paperwork. Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes statement as to DE whereabouts and lack of paperwork. DE did not appear by zoom.  ADA Ness requests warrant and bond forfeiture, body only warrant. Atty Thomas-Schmidt requests bond be stayed to allow DE to make voluntary appearances. Court authorizes warrant, stayed until 6/23 at 4:30 pm.  4:06 DE appears in person. Court addresses DE on his lack of applying for court appointed attorney. 407pm Recess to allow DE to complete paperwork. 22CF29 needs a prelim scheduled. 4:15 pm Set scheduling for 6/23 at 11:00 am for parties, zoom is available. Warrant is quashed. Thomas-Schmidt to remain on 21CF163 22CF07. Traffic cases will continue to track.
Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:09 AM Defendant Isaac Allen James Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Isaac Allen James Smith.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances. In regards to 22CF29- DE needs to get Court appointed paperwork since he no longer qualifies for public defender. The Court questions Atty Thomas-Schmidt. The Court questions the DE. The Court questions Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Atty Thomas-Schmidt waives further reading and enters pleas of not guilty on all cases and counts except 22CF29. Atty Thomas-Schmidt waives time limits. Set for status. Adjourned.

Court speaks to the parties re: the probable cause statement. Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes statement. State speaks to the court. Court finds probable cause. Court questions the def. State makes bond argument. No objection from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Court sets bond.
